overview: Mark is responsible for technology and product development vision and execution. Prior to co-founding FanSnap, Mark was VP of Engineering and Product Development at Flock, where he led the team building their innovative web browser optimized for the social web. Before that, he was an Entrepreneur-in-Residence at Shasta Ventures, where he helped evaluate early-stage companies for potential investment. Mark was VP of Engineering for NexTag, a leading online shopping comparison company, and also VP of Engineering at Walmart.com, the online division of the retail giant. He was also with HomeWarehouse.com, mPower, Inc., Sun Microsystems, Microdyne Corp., FTP Software, and Racal InterLan. Mark holds several patents. Mark received a BSE in Computer Science from Princeton University.
